title: Highlands Regional Medical Center
text:
Highlands Regional Medical Center is a hospital in <a href="Prestonsburg%2C%20Kentucky">Prestonsburg, Kentucky</a>. A 184-bed, nonprofit healthcare facility owned and operated by the Prestonsburg and <a href="Paintsville%2C%20Kentucky">Paintsville</a> communities, it serves the counties of <a href="Floyd%20County%2C%20Kentucky">Floyd</a>, <a href="Johnson%20County%2C%20Kentucky">Johnson</a>, <a href="Martin%20County%2C%20Kentucky">Martin</a>, and <a href="Magoffin%20County%2C%20Kentucky">Magoffin</a>, a combined population of over 90,000.
Location.
HRMC is at the intersection of State Routes <a href="Kentucky%20Route%203">3</a> and <a href="Kentucky%20Route%20321">321</a>. It is from Prestonsburg, from Paintsville, from <a href="Salyersville%2C%20Kentucky">Salyersville</a>, from <a href="Inez%2C%20Kentucky">Inez</a>, from <a href="Pikeville%2C%20Kentucky">Pikeville</a>, and from <a href="Ashland%2C%20Kentucky">Ashland</a>.
Medical services.
Among the medical fields practiced at HRMC are <a href="family%20practice">family practice</a>, <a href="cardiology">cardiology</a>, <a href="gynecology">obstetrics/gynecology</a>, <a href="pediatrics">pediatrics</a>, <a href="internal%20medicine">internal medicine</a>, <a href="orthopedics">orthopedics</a>, <a href="urology">urology</a> and <a href="otolaryngology">otolaryngology</a>. Highlands Regional is also accredited through the <a href="Joint%20Commission">Joint Commission on Accreditation of Health Care Organizations (JCAHO)</a>.
HRMC is also home to Highlands Clinic, a specialty care clinic offering 25 areas of specialty medicine. These specialty clinics are staffed by physicians from the <a href="University%20of%20Kentucky">University of Kentucky</a> and other medical specialists from around the commonwealth who travel to the clinic on a weekly or biweekly basis to provide consultant or follow-up care in multiple areas. These include <a href="neurosurgery">neurosurgery</a>, <a href="oncology">oncology</a>, <a href="cardio-thoracic">cardio-thoracic</a>, and high-risk <a href="prenatal%20care">prenatal care</a>, among others. The purpose of these specialty clinics is to eliminate the need for patients to travel to <a href="Lexington%2C%20Kentucky">Lexington</a> to see a specialist. These clinics are bi-located, with one on site at the HRMC main campus, and the other located in Paintsville.
